She heard a sound in a dark place in the jungle, so she went to investigate what that was. A creature that had never been seen attack her. Her partner only heard a shout and they found Lucy, the wife of the man, on the floor. They asked her if she was OK, but she didn't answer, so her partner took her to the doctor. instance_text.feedback: When the verb "experiment" is used with a direct object like "new exotic cuisines," the preposition "with" must be used as a connector. Add "with" before "new exotic cuisines."

instance_text.source: Suddenly two people dressed as astronauts were leaving the park and warned the young boys to go to their house and wait until this unfortunately event was over.
instance_text.corrected: Suddenly two people dressed as astronauts were leaving the park and warned the young boys to go to their house and wait until this unfortunate event was over.
instance_text.feedback: The word 'unfortunately' is an adverb, but here you need an adjective to describe the noun 'event.' Change 'unfortunately' to 'unfortunate' to correctly describe the event.

instance_text.source: Firstly, the city of Vancouver has a programme called Go Green Vancouver that will protect the environment by separating the rubbish by containers. At the same time, there is a collaboration from the city hall of any district that it will provide a 3 containers for each house; one for paper one for bottles, and the last one for rubbish materials.

instance_text.source: Science nowadays has developed a lot and gave the population a lot of possibilities, like storing stem cells and using them to treat future health problems anyone can have.
instance_text.corrected: Science nowadays has developed a lot and has given the population a lot of possibilities, like storing stem cells and using them to treat future health problems anyone can have.
instance_text.feedback: When describing something that started in the past and continues now, use the present perfect tense (have/has + past participle of the verb). Change "gave" to its present perfect form.

instance_text.feedback: When describing whether something ever happened, use the present perfect tense (have/has + past participle of the verb). Change "imagine" to its present perfect form.
